ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2hr/week
0- was a seminar.
Given the nature of the course i.e. seminar, the workload is extremely less (~1 hour/week)

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: very informative
Great insight to the world of administration, management , consulting and policy maneurvaring.

One of the best experiences I've had overall at Yale- Professor Forman consistently brings interesting and relevant speakers that provide actionable advice for students that have aspirations of leadership in healthcare.

Strengths:1.An excellent collection of speakers2.Great functional diversity as for the speakers backgroundWeaknesses:1. Increased focus on the US Healthcare system2. Room for including healthcare leaders from around the globe
Wonderful seminar with stimulating speakers. I learned so much from witnessing these unique career paths.
Great speakers!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard P Forman  great teacher
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Provided an atmosphere of good intellectual discussion.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Professor Forman is one of YSPH's most valuable assets- he's not only a wonderful and effective teacher, but he also serves as a mentor and guide for many of us in the policy and management programs.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Strengths:1.Qualities at par with what one would look for in an ideal mentor2.Excellent time management and feedback skills3.Increased depth of subject knowledge in the field of medicine, economics and business4.Always has an answer to the most recent news relate to healthcare

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Excellent and genuine professor who believes in his students. Humor is tough to read at first, but he becomes very likeable and relate-able after time and more interaction. Overall, an inspiration for many of his students.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Stellar

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: highly recommend
Consider this seminar course even if a policy student. Has a lot of quest speaker who have worked on major legislation and policies.Very great course
I wish the communications from the class was clearer..

This seminar series provides students the opportunity to learn from and interact with incredibly relevant and inspirational leaders from various facets within the U.S. healthcare system. Don't miss a single seminar...

Great seminar series for students looking to interact with leaders in healthcare. Provides a great networking opportunity, less workload and substantial take away's through experiences of achievers in the healthcare space
Great way to get exposure to accomplished leaders. It also give you a chance to step out and learn how to ask thought provoking questions during discussions.
